sub_topic: Calculating the volume of a rectangular pyramid.
message_1: A rectangular pyramid has a length of 10 cm, a width of 6 cm and a height of 4 cm. Find its volume.
message_2:
To find the volume of a rectangular pyramid, we can use the formula:

Volume = (1/3) × length × width × height

Given the dimensions of the pyramid are:
Length = 10 cm
Width = 6 cm
Height = 4 cm

We can plug these values into the formula:

Volume = (1/3) × 10 cm × 6 cm × 4 cm

Volume = (1/3) × 240 cubic cm

Volume = 80 cubic cm

So, the volume of the rectangular pyramid is 80 cubic centimeters.
